p: During the first 5 days of the hospital stay, the clinical conditions and the vital signs of the patient were stable (afebrile, SpO 2 90–92% at 10 L/min, and FiO 2 40%). On the sixth day, the patient showed a significant worsening of the shortness of breath and oxygen saturation (SpO2 87%), indeed respiratory support by CPAP machine was started (FiO2 100%, PEEP 12 cmH 2O).
